intro: Pedicularis connata, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, alpine habitats and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
